meanings.definition: The act of uniting or sticking together in a mass.
meanings.sent1: The agglutination of the puzzle pieces made it easier to see the whole picture.
meanings.sent2: The agglutination of the ingredients created a delicious cake.
meanings.sent3: The agglutination of the socks in the laundry made them impossible to separate.
meanings.sent4: The agglutination of ideas in her mind led to a brilliant solution.
meanings.sent5: The agglutination of colors in the painting brought it to life.

meanings.definition: The process of forming words by combining morphemes without changing them.
meanings.sent1: In linguistics, agglutination is a fascinating way to create new words.
meanings.sent2: The agglutination of prefixes and suffixes can change the meaning of a word.
meanings.sent3: The agglutination of emojis in her text messages made them hard to decipher.
meanings.sent4: The agglutination of sounds in a language can vary greatly between different cultures.
meanings.sent5: The agglutination of syllables in poetry can create beautiful rhythms.
